required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Enamel Demineralization During Clear Aligner Orthodontic Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Enamel Demineralization During Clear Aligner Orthodontic Treatment With QLF Compared to Conventional Fixed Appliances: a Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Jordan University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Jordan University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: Development of white spot lesions (enamel demineralization) will be evaluated quantitatively during clear aligner orthodontic treatment compared to conventional fixed appliances using quantitative light induced fluorescence (QLF)

detailed_description.textblock: White spot lesion (WSL) may develop around fixed orthodontic appliances. With clear aligners, however, the issue is not controversial. WSL will be monitored in 2 groups of patients; one group using clear aligners and one group wearing fixed orthodontic appliances for 3 months. QLF images will be taken before treatment (T0) and 3 months after commencement of the treatment (T1). The results will be compared between the two groups

primary_outcome.description: Incidence of the white spot lesion area

secondary_outcome.description: The number of newly developed white spot lesion during orthodontic treatment
Rate of plaque on tooth surfaces

arm_group.description: Group 2 treated with conventional fixed appliances

intervention.description: Included orthodontic treatment with clear aligner (eon Aligners)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy patients from both genders aged (17 - 24 years).
- Class I malocclusion with mild to moderate crowding (≤ 5 mm).
- Non-extraction treatment plan.
- Optimum oral Hygiene before treatment with no signs of gingivitis and/or periodontitis.
- Maximum of 3 restored teeth.
- Absence of defective enamel formation in the form of hypocalcification or hypoplasia.
Exclusion Criteria:
-Patients with poor oral hygiene, defective enamel, extensive restorations and salivary glands diseases were excluded.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
